eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: StayOnScreen
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move the object to keep it visible on the screen.
description: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.
The shoot'em up example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://space-shooter)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.

eventsFunctions.name: MarginRight

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PopUp
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Display pop-ups to alert, ask confirmation, and let user type a response in text box.
description: This extension adds actions to display three kinds of pop-ups.
## Alert
- Pops-up a message that will pause the game until dismissed by the player.
## Confirmation
- Pops-up a dialogue containing a message with the option to either confirm or cancel.
## Prompt
**Note that this pop-up type is unsupported on previews and PC exports.**
- Displays a message to the player with a text field to write an answer in. The player will also have the option to either confirm or discard their input.
### Usage to save a value from a popup box:
![Screenshot of the way to use the extension to save a value in a variable](https://i.imgur.com/2iR5ofz.png)

eventsFunctions.description: The response to a pop-up message is filled.

eventsFunctions.description: Displays a prompt in a pop-up that prompts the user for input. This action return the text input or the false boolean if canceled.
eventsFunctions.name: Prompt
eventsFunctions.sentence: Open a prompt pop-up box with message: _PARAM1_ (placeholder: _PARAM2_)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Sticker
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make objects follow the position and rotation of the object they are stuck to.
description: This extension can be useful to:
* Stick accessories to moving objects
* Animate a skeleton
* Delete an object with another one
An example allows to check it out ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://stick-objects)).

eventsFunctions.description: Define helper classes JavaScript code.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineHelperClasses

inlineCode: * Update the coordinates in the basisObject basis.
* It uses the basisObject coordinates from the previous frame.
* This way, the sticker can move relatively to it and still
// Save initial values to avoid calculus and rounding errors
* Copy the coordinates to use it the next frame.
* This method is also called by children to ensure
// If the behavior on the basis object has a different name,
// the objects will still follow their basis objects
// Follow parents 1st to avoid frame delays
object.setX(basisObject.getCenterXInScene() + object.getX() - object.getCenterXInScene() + deltaX * Math.cos(angle) + deltaY * Math.sin(angle));
object.setY(basisObject.getCenterYInScene() + object.getY() - object.getCenterYInScene() - deltaX * Math.sin(angle) + deltaY * Math.cos(angle));
// Unproportional dimensions changes won't work as expected
// if the object angle is not null but nothing more can be done
// because there is no full affine transformation on objects.

eventsFunctions.name: Stick

eventsFunctions.name: Unstick

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Gustavo Marciano
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: YSort
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create an illusion of depth by setting the Z-order based on the Y position of the object. Useful for isometric games, 2D games with a "Top-Down" view, RPG...
description: Set the depth (Z-order) of the instance to the value of its Y position in the scene, creating an illusion of depth. The origin point of the object is used to determine the Z-order.
This is useful for:
- isometric games ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://isometric-game))
- top-down games ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-grid-movement))

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Set the depth (Z-order) of the instance to the value of its Y position in the scene, creating an illusion of depth. The origin point of the object is used to determine the Z-order.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: YSort

events.comment: This is done in doStepPostEvents because the sort must happens right before the rendering to avoid a 1 frame delay.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (tristan@victrisgames.com), Entropy
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ScreenWrap
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Teleport object when it moves off the screen and immediately appear on the opposite side while maintaining speed and trajectory.
description: The teleport happens when the center point of the object crosses a border (this can be adjusted with an offset).
By default, the borders of the wrapping area match the screen size, but they can alo be changed.
The Asteroid-like example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://space-asteroid)).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: LinearMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move the object linearly, according to the speed configured on X and Y axis. Useful for simple enemies, bullets or objects following a straight line on the screen.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Move the object linearly, according to the speed configured on X and Y axis. Useful for simple enemies, bullets or objects following a straight line on the screen.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move the object linearly, according to the speed configured on X and Y axis. Useful for simple enemies, bullets or objects following a straight line on the screen.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: LinearMovement

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PixelPerfectMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Grid-based or pixel perfect platformer and top-down movements.
description: Games with pixel art usually use pixels bigger than actual pixels of the screen. This can lead to big pixels partially overlapping each other which doesn't look good.
This extension allows to seamlessly keep big pixels aligned when the object is stopped and still beneficiate from the high resolution of the screen to have smooth movements.
It can be used for:
* Pixel-perfect platformers ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer-with-tilemap))
* Align top-down characters on a grid ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-grid-movement))

eventsFunctions.description: Return the speed necessary to cover a distance according to the deceleration.
eventsFunctions.name: SpeedToReach
eventsFunctions.sentence: Braking distance from an initial speed: _PARAM2_ and a deceleration: _PARAM3_ is less than _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Return the braking distance according to an initial speed and a deceleration.
eventsFunctions.name: BrakingDistance
eventsFunctions.sentence: Braking distance from an initial speed: _PARAM2_ and a deceleration: _PARAM3_ is less than _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Define JavaScript classes for top-down.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineJavaScriptForTopDown

inlineCode: * Return the direction to use instead of the direction given in
// Forbid to turn before being aligned on the grid.
// Ensure sharp turn even with Verlet integrations.
* Called before the acceleration and new direction is applied to the
// Find where the deceleration should stop the object.
// Find where the deceleration should stop the object.
// Make as if the player had press button a bit longer to reach exactly
// The velocity is exact. There no need for Verlet integration.
// The velocity is exact. There no need for Verlet integration.
* Called before the velocity is applied to the object position and
// The velocity is exact. There no need for Verlet integration.
// The velocity is exact. There no need for Verlet integration.
// Avoid rounding errors after a call to "separate" to make characters
// move indefinitely in front of a wall because they can't reach the cell.
* @returns {number} the braking distance according to an initial speed and a deceleration.
* @returns {number} the braking distance according to an initial speed and a deceleration.
* @returns {number} the speed necessary to cover a distance according to the deceleration.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Seamlessly align big pixels using a top-down movement.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: PixelPerfectTopDownMovement

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Seamlessly align big pixels using a platformer character movement.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: PixelPerfectPlatformerCharacter

events.comment: We don't know if the deceleration was already applied or not this step, but if the speed drifted from more than 1%, another extension is probably modifying the speed and it must not be overridden.
Find how far to go to reach a pixel.
Move to the target as the movement behavior would do.
Find how far to go to reach a pixel.
Move to the target as the movement behavior would do.

Check if the character is decelerating.
It's done in doStepPostEvent because there is no way to know if the doStepPreEvents of this behavior is executed before or after the one of PlatformerCharcter.
As TimeDelta is used, we have to be sure the last PlatformerCharcter.doStepPreEvents call used the same TimeDelta. Which means this must be done after PlatformerCharcter.doStepPreEvents.
Save the speed to detect speed changes from outside.
